Key decisions already fixed by you

docs/documentation_governance.md ‚Äì system-level doc types & hierarchy.

docs/build/documentation_protocol.md ‚Äì build-only update protocol & GPT behaviour.

P0.3 should define a phase-agnostic, long-term framework (not just Phase 0).

Architects may propose new docs only when they truly SHOULD exist, and must push you for approval; runtime-generated artefacts (logs, etc.) are out of scope for P0.3 and can be defined later.

Build protocol must not duplicate rules already in Canon/Tech Spec/etc.; if it centralizes rules, the old copies should be removed and replaced with references, and the protocol doc must be added to gpt_resource_index and the ‚Äúalways-load‚Äù set.

P0.3.1 ‚Äî Define Documentation Layers & Categories (System-Level Governance)

Type: Implementer
Phase: 0

Description

Define the core documentation layers and categories for LillyCORE, independent of specific files. Establish what types of documents the system may have, what their purposes are, and how they relate to each other. This forms the initial foundation of docs/documentation_governance.md.

Steps

Review PROJECT_CANON, tech_spec, gpt_resource_index, and modules to extract existing documentation-related constraints.

Define the system-level document categories (e.g., build docs, system docs, plugin docs, user-facing docs, runtime-generated artifacts).

For each category, specify purpose, intended audience, and ownership (Architect, Implementer, plugin owners, etc.).

Define which categories the system is allowed to have, should have, and must not have.

Create the initial content of docs/documentation_governance.md containing:

Purpose

Overview of documentation categories

Definitions for each category

Verify whether any conceptual overlap exists between these definitions and PROJECT_CANON ¬ß4; if so, record that awareness internally (no deliverable) and continue.

Present the resulting structure to Andrew for confirmation that the conceptual model matches intention.

Deliverables

New file: docs/documentation_governance.md with Purpose + Documentation Categories + Definitions.

Done When

The new doc exists with clear, system-level definitions.

Andrew confirms these definitions match his intent.
